answers.answer: Hi Parents911,Welcome to MedHelps' Pain Mangement Forum. I am glad you have found us but sorry to hear about your father's painful symptoms.Does he have diabetes? This can effect the circulation in his extremities. Has the physician mentioned PAD (Peripheral Artery disease ) or PVD (Peripheral Vascular disease)? These are painful circulatory disease/conditions that require treatment and attention. You may want to see a physician that treats and specializes in vascular disease.  I am not suggesting that this this is his diagnosis. I am just speculating and encouraging you to help him uncover the cause.There seems to me that there should be an explanation for the pain he is experiencing in his lower extremities. I am glad that they are attempting to treat his discomfort but the real issue should be what is causing it.Don't be afraid to take him to another physician to get to the bottom of all this. An Internal Medicine Physician or if he is 55 or older a gerontologist may be a good place to begin. You are right to be concerned and demand answers and solutions.Your father is fortunate to have a caring, concerned and supportive daughter. Help him find the right physician. Please keep in touch and let us know how he is doing. I will watch for your updates.Take Care,Tuck

question: My father has had severe leg pain for the past 2months. He has gone to see the Dr twice now.They just give him pain killers. Somedays he has to lift his leg with his hands himself because the painis so bad. The last Dr appt the Dr said my father has flat feet therefore no arch and would be some ofthe cause of the leg pain. My dad just went and purchased arch support.My dad's history is he had Angioplasty and Vascular Stenting quite a few years ago and I am wonderingif this would be the cause of his leg pain at all?
title: Pain in leg
